task.title: Changing the Java compiler version for a J2EE project
task.shortdesc: You can change the version of Java used in a J2EE project by changing the value of the Java facet.

context.p: The Java facet applies only to J2EE projects. To set the Java compiler level of a non-J2EE project, such as a Java project, see Java Compiler.

step.cmd: In the Project Explorer view, right-click the project and then click Properties.
In the Properties window, click Project Facets.
step.stepresult: The Project Facets page lists the facets in the project.

step.cmd: In the Add/Remove Project Facets window, click the Java facet to select it.
Select the level of Java compiler to use from the drop-down box next to the Java facet.
